Key Match Events: Shubman Gill helped India past the 100 run mark with a boundary in the 10th over.
Yashasvi Jaiswal hit a boundary of Muzarbani to help team India secure a 10 wicket victory in Harare.
Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal both have shown willingness to free their arms and go over the boundary line when the situation demands.
Pre-Game Insights: India look to secure the series by taking a 3-1 lead in the 5-match T20I series.
Skipper Shubman Gill won the toss and decided to bowl first.
Yuvraj Singh praised his prodigy, Abhishek Sharma, after the left-handed batter had scored a 46-ball century in the 2nd T20I match against Zimbabwe.
Post-Match Reflections: While Jaiswal narrowly missed out on a century, he will probably cherish this innings more given that it came in a winning cause.
Team India should feel inspired by the fact that on this day, July 13, India defeated England in the NatWest Series final in 2002.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Vijay Khanduja, the Ambassador of India to the Republic of Zimbabwe, hosted Team India ahead of the fourth match.

The match will start at 4:30 PM (India time), which means it's 1 PM (local time). The temperature in Harare on July 13 afternoon will be around 24 degrees, as per AccuWeather. Thereâ€™s no chance of rain. The humidity will be 20% throughout the match.
Others: Shubman Gill is the top run-scorer in the tournament so far. He has scored 99 runs so far.
Ruturaj Gaikwad is the top run-scorer in the tournament so far. He has scored 133 runs with an average of 66.50.
